name: North Carolina African-American Homeschoolers
address: 405 C Mason Farm Rd, Chapel Hill, NC 27514
description: This group aims to provide a central point of community and resources for homeschoolers of color in North Carolina, offering opportunities for socialization and community building
services: African-American-owned Homeschool networks in North-Carolina consultation

name: African American Homeschool Network
address: Primarily a Facebook community, with no specific physical address listed
description: This Facebook community serves as a prelude to a membership site, aiming to support, encourage, and promote African American homeschool families, including curriculum selection and co-op group startup
services: African-American-owned Homeschool networks in North-Carolina consultation

name: Homeschoolers of Color
address: Based in the Piedmont region of North Carolina, with members in Alamance, Chatham, Durham, Johnston, Lee, and Orange Counties. No single physical address is listed
description: This group is dedicated to supporting homeschoolers of color and their families, providing opportunities to connect, play, explore, and learn together
services: African-American-owned Homeschool networks in North-Carolina consultation

name: African American Homeschoolers of Fayetteville, NC
address: Fayetteville, NC. No specific street address provided
description: This group consists of African American families joining forces to strengthen and expand the Black learning community, share resources, and promote unity

name: Akoma Cares
address: Serves melanated families across the Carolinas, with no specific North Carolina address listed
description: Akoma Cares aims to create quality programs and services for melanated families, focusing on education and community support
services: African-American-owned Homeschool networks in North-Carolina consultation

name: National Black Home Educators (NBHE)
address: Founded in 2000, it is an international organization with a mission to serve African American homeschooling families. No specific North Carolina physical address is listed
description: NBHE provides resources, curriculum, and community for African American homeschooling families, promoting parent-directed education and empowering parents
services: African-American-owned Homeschool networks in North-Carolina consultation

name: Afrocentric Homeschoolers Association Email Group
description: This group is a resource for Black homeschoolers and those interested in teaching children about Black history and culture, open to Black individuals and others
services: African-American-owned Homeschool networks in North-Carolina consultation
